page.title: 01SKIPSEA GAZETTEER
page.content: {Skipsea}is a coastal village which is threatened by erosion losing quite a large amount of land each year.There is a mound on the site of a Norman motte and bailey castle, first built by Dru de la Beuvriere. Stones from the ruin were used in building the church. There are various campsites and a few shops, and farms which are mostly arable ,but some also breed amimals and have milk herds. The church runs a Sunday school and there is also a chapel.The school serves five villages and cubs meet there once a week. There is also a youth club a village hall and village green and play area. The sea has claimed many bungalows. There used to be a village called Cleeton but it has now been destroyed by the sea.
